item.title: Who is SN Subrahmanyan, L&T chairman under fire for ‘90-hour work week’ remark? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who is SN Subrahmanyan, L&T chairman under fire for ‘90-hour work week’ remark?

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

SN Subrahmanyan, chairman of Larsen & Toubro (L&T), faced backlash for suggesting that employees should work 90 hours a week, including Sundays. His remarks sparked a significant response from the public and celebrities alike.

  • Subrahmanyan joined L&T in 1984 and became chairman and MD in October 2023.
  • His comments have been criticized by various stakeholders, including actress Deepika Padukone.
  • Subrahmanyan has overseen several major projects during his tenure at L&T.
  • He has received multiple awards and accolades, including the Eminent Engineer award in 2024.
“Shocking to see people in such senior positions make such statements. #MentalHealthMatters.” - Deepika Padukone

The incident has triggered discussions around work-life balance and employee well-being in a corporate context.

item.title: Stocks to Watch on January 10: TCS, IREDA, Adani Wilmar, Phoenix Mills and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 10: TCS, IREDA, Adani Wilmar, Phoenix Mills and More

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights key stocks to monitor in the market today, including TCS, IREDA, Adani Wilmar, and others. It covers corporate earnings, profit changes, and significant business announcements.

  • TCS: Reported an 11.95% increase in net profit to ₹12,380 crore.
  • IREDA: Achieved a 26.8% year-on-year increase in net profit for Q3 FY25.
  • Adani Wilmar: Announced a 13.5% stake sale through an OFS by its founder.
  • Adani Total Gas: Confirmed a 20% increase in APM gas allocation starting January 16, 2025.
  • Phoenix Mills: Reported a 21% rise in retail consumption for Q3 FY25.
  • GTPL Hathway: Experienced a 57.2% YoY decline in net profit.
  • Indian Overseas Bank: Invited EOIs for the sale of 46 NPA accounts valued at ₹11,500 crore.
  • Reliance Industries: Will announce its Q3 results on January 16, 2025.
  • Tata Elxsi: Reported a 13.3% decline in net profit for the December quarter.
  • Hindustan Zinc: Disclosed a penalty of ₹35.35 crore from the State Tax department.
  • BGR Energy Systems: Cleared previous tax liabilities, confirmed by a rectification order.
  • Polyplex Corporation: Planning new BOPET manufacturing capacity expansion in India.
"This upward revision will have a positive impact on the company and will help in stabilizing the retail prices to end consumers." - Adani Total Gas statement

The article underscores significant corporate developments and market shifts that investors should monitor, suggesting potential investment opportunities.

item.title: IREDA Q3 results: Net profits rise 27% YoY to ₹425.35 crore; revenue up 37% | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
IREDA Q3 results: Net profits rise 27% YoY to ₹425.35 crore; revenue up 37%

Date: January 9, 2024

Source: Live Mint

The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) has reported a significant increase in net profits and revenue for the third quarter of the financial year 2024-25, reflecting a positive performance amidst rising expenses.

  • Net profits rose 27% to ₹425.38 crore compared to ₹335.53 crore in the same quarter last year.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 37% to ₹1,654.45 crore from ₹1,208.10 crore.
  • Total expenses for the quarter grew by 33.8% to ₹1,160.78 crore.
  • IREDA shares closed 3.31% lower at ₹215.90 after the results were released.
  • Gross non-performing assets (NPAs) dropped to 2.68%, down from 2.90% year-over-year.
“IREDA's net worth surged 21% to ₹9,842.07 crore in the third quarter, compared to ₹8,134.56 crore a year ago.”

This positive performance in net profits and revenue highlights IREDA's robust growth and resilience amidst challenging market conditions, suggesting a strong outlook for the company in the renewable energy sector.

item.title: Watch | ‘How long can you stare at your wife?’: L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan wants employees to work on Sundays too, sparks outrage - The Indian Express
item.description:
L&T Chairman Faces Backlash Over Call for 90-Hour Workweeks

Publication Date: January 9, 2025
Source: NextBigWhat.com

In a now-viral video, Larsen & Toubro Chairman SN Subrahmanyan has sparked significant criticism for suggesting that employees should work 90 hours a week, including Sundays.

Subrahmanyan's comments, made during a recent employee interaction, jokingly challenged staff on their weekend activities, suggesting they should be working instead. He also expressed his desire to make employees work on Sundays, emphasizing that he does so himself.

  • Subrahmanyan's comments follow similar remarks by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy, who advocates for longer workweeks in India.
  • Critics slammed the corporate culture at L&T, emphasizing poor working conditions and a high turnover rate.
  • Social media users reacted with humor and outrage, with some highlighting the unrealistic expectations placed on workers.
  • The broader implications of these comments lead to discussions about work-life balance within India's corporate sector.
“How long will you stare at your wife?” L&T chairman wants you to work on Sundays also!

In response, L&T issued a statement asserting that such remarks reflect their ambition for nation-building, although they have faced backlash for implying a lack of respect for employees' personal time.

Overall, this incident has reignited the ongoing debate in India regarding work-life balance and the expectations placed upon employees in the private sector.

item.title: Double counting error: Official gold import figures for Nov revised down by $5 billion - The Indian Express
item.description:
Gold Import Figures Revised Down by $5 Billion Due to Counting Error

Date: January 9, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

The Ministry of Commerce and Industry has revised down the gold import figures for November by $5 billion, highlighting a likely counting error.

  • The revised gold import figures for November are now $9.9 billion instead of the previously reported $14.8 billion.
  • The overall goods trade deficit for the month decreased from $38 billion to $33 billion.
  • The counting error estimated November gold imports at 180 tonnes, which is three times the average for the first ten months of the year.
  • The government has not yet provided an official explanation for the counting error.
  • There was a likely $3-4 billion revision due to a calculation error linked to the recent shift in e-filing services.
The Ministry has yet to clarify the situation regarding the counting error.

This revision sheds light on the importance and volatility of gold imports in India’s economy.

item.title: IREDA Q3 results FY2024-25: PSU reports 35% jump in total income - Check PAT, EBITDA and key earnings - ET Now
item.description:
IREDA Q3 results FY2024-25: PSU reports 35% jump in total income

Updated: January 9, 2025 | Source: ET NOW

The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency Limited (IREDA) reported a significant increase in total income and net profit for the third quarter of FY25, reflecting strong growth in its operations.

  • Total income grew by 35% to Rs 1698.98 crore.
  • Net profit rose by 27% to Rs 425.38 crore compared to Rs 335.53 crore in the same quarter of the previous year.
  • Shares of IREDA fell by 3.42% to Rs 215.75.
  • Loan sanctions jumped 129% year-on-year to Rs 31,087 crore.
  • Outstanding loan book reached Rs 69,000 crore, up 36% from a year earlier.
“The agency provides critical financial support and services to boost green power capacity.”

This growth underscores IREDA's expanding role in the renewable energy sector, promoting sustainable development through increased loan disbursements and sanctions.

item.title: Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction? - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction?

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: CNBC-TV18

Thursday's trading session favored the bears as the market saw a broad-based sell-off, with the Nifty 50 slipping below 23,550. Most sectors faced losses, but the Nifty's direction for the week hinges on the results from TCS, India's largest IT services company.

  • The Nifty 50 index ended at 23,526.50, nearing the day’s low.
  • TCS's revenue for the December quarter was ₹63,973 crore, down 0.4% from the previous quarter.
  • Foreign investors were net sellers while domestic investors were net buyers.
  • The Nifty has declined over 2% for the week.
TCS reported a revenue in US Dollar terms of $7,539 million, slightly below the expected $7,626 million.

This trading dynamic showcases the significance of TCS’s quarterly results on the broader market, particularly within the IT sector.

item.title: Meta’s fact-checking snub in US sets off alarm bells for fact-checkers in India - The Indian Express
item.description:
Meta’s fact-checking snub in US sets off alarm bells for fact-checkers in India

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: The Indian Express

As Meta winds down its third-party fact-checking program in the US, uncertainty looms for fact-checkers in India, many of whom depend on Meta for funding and visibility.

  • Meta announced halting its third-party fact-checking program in the US, replacing it with community-driven systems.
  • Indian fact-checkers are concerned about potential funding losses and reduced traffic to their websites.
  • Meta collaborates with 12 fact-checking partners in India, including major publishers and smaller entities.
  • Meta’s shift may be motivated by a new alignment with the Trump administration.
“This is possibly the biggest existential threat many fact checkers will have to contend with.” - Anonymous Senior Executive from a Fact-Checking Organization

The changes by Meta could have lasting implications for media credibility in regions reliant on their fact-checking programs.

item.title: Deepika Padukone calls out L&T chairman for wanting employees to work everyday: ‘Shocking to see such…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Deepika Padukone Criticizes L&T Chairman's Comments on Employee Work Hours

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Larsen & Toubro's chairman, SN Subrahmanyan, sparked controversy with his remarks about employees working on Sundays. Deepika Padukone, a known mental health advocate, criticized these comments, highlighting the importance of work-life balance.

  • Deepika Padukone reacted to SN Subrahmanyan's comments regarding workplace expectations.
  • Subrahmanyan suggested that employees should work on Sundays, which is deemed unusual in modern workplaces.
  • His comments included questioning how employees spend their downtime at home.
  • Deepika expressed her shock over such statements from someone in a senior position.
  • L&T responded by emphasizing their commitment to nation-building and the need for extraordinary effort.
  • Deepika has been a prominent advocate for mental health in India.
“Shocking to see people in such senior positions make such statements. #MentalHealthMatters.” - Deepika Padukone

In conclusion, the incident has ignited discussions on work-life balance and corporate culture, prompting a closer look at the expectations placed on employees in large organizations.

item.title: TCS Q3 results take aways: Profit, dividend, attrition rate, among 5 key details to know - The Economic Times
item.description:
TCS Q3 Results: Key Takeaways on Profit, Dividend, and Attrition

Publication Date: Thursday, January 18, 2024 | Source: Economic Times

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) reported a 12% rise in consolidated net profit for Q3 FY2024, reaching Rs 12,380 crore. The results highlight the company's robust performance amid market challenges.

  • Consolidated Net Profit: Rs 12,380 crore, up from Rs 11,058 crore year-on-year.
  • Revenue: Rs 63,973 crore with a 5.6% increase compared to the previous year.
  • Dividend Declared: Total of Rs 76 per share, including a special dividend of Rs 66.
  • Total Contract Value (TCV): Grew to $10.2 billion with a book-to-bill ratio of 1.4.
  • Attrition Rate: Last twelve months attrition in IT services stands at 13.0%.
“BFSI and CBG returning to growth, continued stellar run of Regional Markets and early signs of revival in discretionary spend give us confidence for the future.” - K. Krithivasan, CEO

The strong financial performance and strategic initiatives position TCS for sustained growth despite market volatility.

item.title: Meta’s new move: What are Community Notes and can they really replace fact-checkers? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Meta’s new move: What are Community Notes and can they really replace fact-checkers?

Date: January 7, 2023 | Source: Indian Express

Meta's recent decision to discontinue its independent fact-checking program in the US has caused significant backlash and raised discussions about the company's strategy against misinformation.

  • The 'Community Notes' system will replace traditional fact-checking, similar to Twitter's model.
  • This shift follows criticisms of bias in expert fact-checking from Meta.
  • Officials from the International Fact-Checking Network contend that Meta's decision undermines unbiased reporting.
  • Community Notes will allow users to contribute helpful context to posts, improving with public engagement.
  • The approach aims to prevent bias by requiring diverse participation in ratings.
  • Challenges remain, including the potential for manipulation and capturing nuanced misinformation.
“Experts, like everyone else, have their own biases and perspectives.” – Meta's Blog Post

Meta's move to Community Notes could signify a broader shift in content moderation, but the effectiveness in combating misinformation remains uncertain.

item.title: 2025 Bajaj Pulsar RS200 Launched In India Priced At Rs 1.84 Lakh - NDTV
item.description:
2025 Bajaj Pulsar RS200 Launched In India Priced At Rs 1.84 Lakh

Publication Date: Not available Source: Not available

Bajaj Auto has launched the 2025 iteration of the Pulsar RS200 in the Indian market at a starting price of Rs 1.84 lakh (ex-showroom). This is the only fully-faired bike in the brand's lineup and features a 200 cc engine.

  • This launch continues the Pulsar legacy as the bike was initially launched in 2015.
  • Design aspects include twin-projector LED headlamps and sharp fairing lines for an aggressive look.
  • Features an updated LCD instrument cluster with Bluetooth connectivity and navigation capabilities.
  • Offers three riding modes: Rain, Off-road, and Road.
  • Equipped with telescopic front suspension and a Nitrox mono shock absorber at the rear.
  • Powered by a 200 cc liquid-cooled engine producing 24 hp and 18.74 Nm of torque.
  • The bike utilizes a six-speed transmission with an assist and slipper clutch for smoother gear shifts.

item.title: 2025 Bajaj Pulsar RS 200 launched at Rs. 1.84 lakh - BikeWale
item.description:
2025 Bajaj Pulsar RS 200 launched at Rs. 1.84 lakh

Date: October 2023 Source: BikeWale

Bajaj Auto has launched the updated Pulsar RS 200 in India, featuring new features and a revised design, now priced at Rs. 1,84,115.

  • New features added
  • Updated graphics and revised tail section
  • Price increased by Rs. 10,000
“The bike now also has more features than before.”

The updated RS 200 now incorporates additional technology and maintains its classic design while elevating the riding experience.

item.title: Reliance Industries to announce October-December quarter earnings on January 16 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Reliance Industries to Announce Q3 FY25 Earnings on January 16

Publication Date: January 9, 2025

Source: Live Mint

Reliance Industries, India's most valuable company, will announce its earnings for the third quarter of financial year 2024-25 on January 16, 2025. The company will disclose both standalone and consolidated unaudited financial results during a Board meeting on that date.

Key Points

  • The announcement is scheduled for January 16, 2025.
  • Expectations include a 9.4% increase in OTC segment earnings QoQ.
  • RJio's EBITDA is projected to rise by 3.3% QoQ.
  • Brokerage estimates suggest consolidated EBITDA/PAT growth of 8%/10% QoQ.
  • Motilal Oswal Financial Services anticipates YoY growth of EBITDA by 4% to ₹42,100 crore.
  • Reliance’s share price has decreased over 21% in the last six months.
“We foresee an upside potential of up to 36 per cent in Reliance shares following the recent correction.”

The upcoming earnings release is highly anticipated as it may provide insights into the company's performance amid current market challenges.

item.title: Bank Officers' Union Threatens To Call On Two-Day Nationwide Strike - News18
item.description:
Bank Officers' Union Threatens Nationwide Strike in February

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: News18

Bank officers’ union AIBOC has threatened to go on a nationwide strike on February 24-25 to press for a five-day workweek and adequate recruitment in all cadres.

  • The union demands the withdrawal of recent directives by the Department of Financial Services affecting job security.
  • They seek the appointment of workmen/officer directors in public sector banks.
  • Agitation programs will commence after notice of the strike is served.
“If required, more stringent actions may follow,” stated AIBOC.

This potential strike reflects growing tensions regarding the management of public sector banks and their policies.

item.title: Adani Wilmar's OFS for 20% stake opens January 10, floor price Rs 275 per share - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Adani Wilmar's OFS for 20% stake opens January 10, floor price Rs 275 per share

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Adani Commodities is set to sell up to 20% of its stake in Adani Wilmar through an Offer For Sale (OFS) commencing on January 10, with a floor price of Rs 275 per share.

  • OFS will involve a base offer of 13.5% equity with a green shoe option for another 6.5% share.
  • The sale includes 17.54 crore shares, reserving 25% for mutual funds and insurance companies.
  • Multiple brokers are facilitating the OFS, including ICICI Securities and Jefferies.
  • Shares of Adani Wilmar are currently trading at Rs 324, down 13% from last year.
"Adani Commodities LLP will be selling 17.54 crore shares as the Base Offer on January 10 and 13."

The upcoming OFS represents a strategic move for Adani Commodities, aiming to restructure its equity distribution while providing investment opportunities to stakeholders.

item.title: TCS Q3 net profit rises 11.95% to ₹12,380 crore - The Hindu
item.description:
TCS Reports 11.95% Increase in Q3 Net Profit to ₹12,380 Crore

Date: January 09, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The country's largest IT services exporter TCS reported an 11.95% jump in net profit for the December quarter, totaling ₹12,380 crore, showing growth from the previous year.

  • Net profit increased from ₹11,058 crore in the same quarter last year.
  • Total income rose 6.13% to ₹65,216 crore compared to ₹61,445 crore last year.
  • Overall expenses grew by 6.33% to ₹48,550 crore compared to ₹45,658 crore in the previous year.
  • TCS's employee count decreased by over 5,000 to 607,354 by the end of the quarter.
“The TCS scrip closed 1.72% down at ₹4,036.65 apiece on the BSE on Thursday.”

Overall, TCS's financial performance for Q3 indicates a positive growth trend despite a decrease in its employee base.

item.title: Adani Group to sell 20% stake in Adani Wilmar through OFS, floor price set at Rs 275 - The Economic Times
item.description:
Adani Group to Sell 20% Stake in Adani Wilmar at Rs 275 Floor Price

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Adani Wilmar is set to have one of its promoters, Adani Commodities LLP, offload up to 20% of its stake in the company through an offer for sale (OFS) beginning January 10.

  • Adani Commodities will sell approximately 17.54 crore shares, representing a 13.5% stake.
  • An oversubscription option is available where an additional 8.44 crore shares (6.5% stake) may also be sold.
  • The fixed floor price for the OFS is Rs 275, which is 15% below the current market price.
  • Only non-retail investors can bid on the first day, but can carry forward bids to the second day if the retail category is undersubscribed.
  • A minimum of 25% is reserved for mutual funds and insurance companies, with 10% for retail investors.
  • The offering will be conducted over two trading days on a separate trading window.

Adani Wilmar is a leading FMCG company formed by a joint venture between Adani Group and Wilmar International.

"Adani Wilmar shares closed 0.6% lower at Rs 324 on NSE."

Investors are advised to review their participation in the upcoming OFS.

item.title: Tata Elxsi reports 3.6% decline in net profit on-year to Rs 199 crore, revenue rises 2.7% - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Tata Elxsi reports 3.6% decline in net profit on-year to Rs 199 crore, revenue rises 2.7%

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Tata Elxsi reported a 3.6% decline in net profit for the December 2024 quarter, despite a rise in revenue. The company attributed the profit decline to geopolitical uncertainty and industry-specific challenges.

  • Net profit declined to Rs 199 crore from Rs 206.43 crore a year ago.
  • Revenue from operations increased to Rs 939.17 crore, a slight decrease from Rs 955.1 crore in the previous quarter.
  • EBITDA fell by 7.7% to Rs 220.07 crore, with a margin decrease from 25.7% to 24.2%.
  • The decline is attributed to geopolitical uncertainty, currency volatility, and challenges in Europe and the US.
“The company attributed decline to geopolitical uncertainty, currency volatility and industry specific challenges in Europe and US.”

This report highlights Tata Elxsi's challenging quarter despite a slight growth in revenue, reflecting broader market uncertainties.

item.title: Watch | ‘How long can you stare at your wife?’: L&T chairman wants employees to work on Sundays too, sparks outrage - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘How long can you stare at your wife?’: L&T chairman wants employees to work on Sundays too, sparks outrage

Published on: January 9, 2025, Source: Indian Express

In a now-viral video, Larsen & Toubro Chairman SN Subrahmanyan has ignited a storm of criticism for suggesting employees should work 90 hours a week, including Sundays.

  • Subrahmanyan joked about employees staring at their wives instead of working and criticized the inability to require Sunday work.
  • Comments drew backlash and comparisons to Narayana Murthy’s controversial 70-hour workweek suggestion.
  • Critics highlighted L&T's corporate culture, questioning the treatment of employees and work-life balance in India.
  • The debate ties into broader discussions on work expectations in India's private sector, with contrasting views from leaders like Infosys founder Narayana Murthy and Swiggy CEO Rohit Kapoor.
“How long will you stare at your wife?” L&T chairman wants you to work on Sundays also!

This comment has reinvigorated conversations about the need for a healthy work-life balance amid growing pressures on employees in corporate settings.

item.title: TCS Q3 Results: Profit rises 12% YoY to Rs 12,380 crore, in-line with estimates - The Economic Times
item.description:
TCS Q3 Results: Profit rises 12% YoY to Rs 12,380 crore, in-line with estimates

Publication Date: Thursday

Source: Economic Times

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) reported a 12% increase in consolidated net profit for Q3, reaching Rs 12,380 crore, in line with market estimates. The revenue stood at Rs 63,973 crore, a 5.6% increase year-on-year, though slightly below expectations.

  • Interim dividend announced: Rs 10 per share
  • Special dividend: Rs 66 per share
  • Total Contract Value (TCV) for the quarter: $10.2 billion
  • Operating margin: 24.5% (down 50 bps YoY)
  • Net cash from operations: Rs 13,032 crore (105.3% of net income)
“BFSI and CBG returning to growth... gives us confidence for the future,” said CEO K Krithivasan.

This quarter’s results reflect TCS's strong positioning for long-term growth despite seasonal challenges.

item.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 fall for second consecutive session. What is driving Indian stock market down? Explained with 5 factors | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Sensex, Nifty 50 fall for second consecutive session. What is driving Indian stock market down? Explained with 5 factors

Date: January 9
Source: Live Mint

In a continuation of a downward trend, the Indian stock market's benchmarks, Sensex and Nifty 50, have declined in response to a combination of weak global cues and internal economic challenges.

The recent decline can be attributed to five key factors impacting investor sentiment:

  • Q3 earnings in focus: Investors await upcoming earnings reports, creating caution in the markets.
  • Rising US bond yields and dollar: Increased bond yields are steering foreign capital away from emerging markets.
  • Heavy selling by FPIs: Foreign portfolio investors are retreating amid concerns over trade policies and interest rates.
  • Macro jitters: Economic growth concerns are significantly affecting investor risk appetite.
  • Uncertainty over US Federal Reserve policies: Speculations about inflation and policy adjustments are causing apprehension.
"The recent fall in the Indian stock market can be attributed to several interconnected factors..." - Atul Parakh, CEO of Bigul

As the situation unfolds, investors are advised to be cautious due to the prevailing market uncertainties.

item.title: Govt plans to give LPG subsidy worth Rs 35,000 cr to IOC, BPCL, and HPCL - Business Standard
item.description:
Government Plans Rs 35,000 Crore LPG Subsidy for IOC, BPCL, HPCL

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Industry Reports

The Indian government is set to provide a Rs 35,000 crore subsidy to state-owned oil companies to compensate for their losses on the sale of domestic LPG, as they have maintained prices amidst rising raw material costs.

  • The companies affected include Indian Oil Corporation Ltd (IOC), Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd (BPCL), and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd (HPCL).
  • Domestic LPG prices have been held at Rs 803 per 14.2-kg cylinder since March 2024 despite higher costs, resulting in significant under-recoveries.
  • The total estimated under-recovery for the LPG sector in the current fiscal year is about Rs 40,500 crore.
  • A government provision for this subsidy is expected to be included in the Union Budget for the 2025-26 fiscal year.
  • Previous compensations of Rs 22,000 crore were also provided to these companies for the fiscal years 2021-22 and 2022-23.
“There is an under-recovery of about Rs 240 per 14.2-kg cylinder that the state-owned fuel retailers sell to domestic households.”

This subsidy aims to alleviate the financial strain on these companies and ensure the sustainability of LPG supplies to households.
